thread.title: D-V No. 1 Chino Valley boys' soccer dominates at Old Pueblo Classic
thread.title_full: D-V No. 1 Chino Valley boys' soccer dominates at Old Pueblo Classic

title: D-V No. 1 Chino Valley boys' soccer dominates at Old Pueblo Classic
text: 10/5/2015 6:26:00 AM D-V No. 1 Chino Valley boys' soccer dominates at Old Pueblo Classic Chino Valley Head Soccer Coach Jim Clark watches from the sideline Tuesday, Sept. 15, while playing against Payson in Chino. (Matt Hinshaw/PNI file) Chino Valley girls improve to 11-4 By BRIAN M. BERGNER JR.The Daily Courierbbergner@prescottaz.comTUCSON, Ariz. - Entering the Old Pueblo Soccer Classic riding a seven-match winning streak, the Chino Valley girls soccer team continued their winning ways this past weekend by taking three of four matches on Friday and Saturday.Chino Valley head coach Allen Foster said this weekend's tournament results came at a bit of a surprise to him."I think it's the best we've ever done in that tournament," said Foster, who saw his team lose to defending Division V state champion Blue Ridge 3-1 in match one Friday, but win out the rest of the tournament. "Our defense the last three games played very well."Chino Valley [11-4 Overall] was tied with Blue Ridge at halftime Friday, 1-1, but then surrendered two goals in the second half including a penalty kick.Freshman Lauren Foster scored the only goal for the Cougars off an assist from junior captain Katielyn Farnsworth.In match two Friday, junior midfielder Maria Arizmendi opened the scoring with a goal in the 5th minute to give the Cougars a 1-0 lead over Show Low. After a handball in the box in the 75th minute, senior midfielder Shelbey Shelton scored off the penalty kick to give Chino Valley the 2-0 win.On Saturday, the offensive floodgates for the Cougars opened up in the second half against Desert Christian. Leading 1-0 at halftime, Farnsworth scored her second goal of the match, which was followed up by goals from Foster and Shelton for a 4-0 win over the Eagles.Later on Saturday, Chino Valley would square off against the Division V runner-up in 2014, Northland Preparatory. The Spartans opened the 2015 season with a 2-1 win at Chino Valley, but on this day, the Cougars would get their revenge.In the 34th minute before halftime, Arizmendi would score her second goal of the tournament to give the Cougars a 1-0 lead, which was the final.Although the three wins this weekend don't count towards the AIA Power Point Poll for Division V, the Cougars are ranked No. 5 heading into this week where they will face rival Camp Verde on Thursday, Oct. 8.The Cowboys are ranked No. 7 in the state with a 4-3-1 record. Chino Valley, which has won 10 of its last 11 matches, has already beaten the Cowboys this season with a 3-1 win on Sept. 17.Official start time is set for 3 p.m.Follow Brian M. Bergner Jr. on Twitter at @SportsWriter52 or reach him by phone at (928) 445-3333, ext. 1106, or (928) 899-6946. Brian M. Bergner Jr. Special to the Review The Division V No. 1-ranked Chino Valley High boys' soccer team won all four of its matches at the Old Pueblo Classic Oct. 2 and 3 in Tucson, led by sensational freshman attacker Jordan Sanchez and Arturo Gomez.At the round-robin tournament, Chino recorded four straight shutouts, defeating No. 3 Show Low, 4-0, and Desert Christian, 1-0, Oct 2, and beating St. Gregory College Prep, 6-0, and Benson, 7-0, Oct. 3.The Cougars have won six consecutive matches, and their record stands at 15-1 overall.Sanchez scored a whopping eight goals in the tourney and now has 20 goals on the season, which is a new Chino Valley High freshman single-season record. In fact, Sanchez shattered the most recent record held by former Cougar Geovanni Vedolla (14).Versus St. Gregory Prep, Sanchez booted in four goals, while teammates Jairo Herrera and Brian Skinner added one apiece. Assists came from Gomez and Walter Soto, each of whom had two. The Cougars led 2-0 at halftime, as Sanchez scored first about 7 minutes into the match.Against Benson, Sanchez registered another hat trick, this time with three goals. Gomez followed with two goals, and Ben Carrizoza and Brian Skinner had one apiece.On Oct. 2, Chino avenged its lone loss of the season to date, with the blanking of Show Low. (Chino lost 3-2 to Show Low at home Sept. 24.)Gomez, who leads the Cougars in goals scored with 26, tallied a natural hat trick, scoring Chino's first three goals in the match. Sanchez also had a goal. The Cougars out-shot Show Low, 25-2.In the tournament opener, Chino and Desert Christian were deadlocked in a scoreless tie at halftime before a Gomez goal decided the match in the second half.Other standouts from the Old Pueblo Classic included goalie Spencer Coffin and the Cougars' defenders, who have now pitched 12 shutouts in 2015. In two tournaments this season, Chino has compiled a 7-0 overall record and hasn't given up a single goal, outscoring the opposition a combined 28-0.The Cougars (3-0 in section) return to section play Thursday, Oct. 8, when they travel to rival Camp Verde. Kickoff is at 6 p.m.
